thread.title: Drug bust leads to charges of trafficking, largest seizure in 20
thread.title_full: Drug bust leads to charges of trafficking, largest seizure in 20 - FOX 14 TV Joplin and Pittsburg News Weather Sports |

author: News Release
title: Drug bust leads to charges of trafficking, largest seizure in 20
text:
VERNON COUNTY, MISSOURI - Two Vernon County residents are in custody after what Sheriff’s Officials are calling their largest drug bust this year for Vernon County. According to records, Julie M Drake, 47 of Nevada and John E Slichenmyer, 45 of Nevada have been charged with 1st degree Trafficking in Drugs, an A felony along with numerous other felony charges.
According to Vernon County Sheriff Jason Mosher, A search warrant was served at a residence on E Lady Rd just North of Nevada early Wednesday morning by the investigations division of the Sheriff’s Office that resulted in the seizure of methamphetamines, marijuana and approximately $4,700 in cash. “We believe there was a large amount of drugs being distributed into our county through this location” Mosher said. The Sheriff said the retail value of the drugs seized would have a street value of over $10,000. “We found numerous containers that had hidden compartments in them so a lot of time and effort had been put into this case.” The Sheriff said the investigation is still ongoing but a large amount of drugs have been taken off the street.
Drake, and Slichenmyer are being held in the Vernon County Jail on a $10,000 cash only bond.
